meanings.definition: The act of ejecting or forcing out someone from a position or place.
meanings.sent1: The ousters of the old board members caused a stir in the company.
meanings.sent2: The ousters of the troublemakers from the classroom improved the learning environment.
meanings.sent3: The ousters of the noisy neighbors made the street much quieter.
meanings.sent4: The ousters of the outdated policies opened up new opportunities for growth.
meanings.sent5: The ousters of the bullies made the school a safer place for everyone.

meanings.definition: The process of removing or expelling someone from a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: The ousters of the disruptive members led to a more harmonious team.
meanings.sent2: The ousters of the dishonest employees restored trust within the company.
meanings.sent3: The ousters of the latecomers made the meetings start on time.
meanings.sent4: The ousters of the troublemakers purged negativity from the group.
meanings.sent5: The ousters of the rule-breakers set a clear example for others to follow.
